name: .OV2
summary: Learn about .OV2 files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

instructions: To import an OV2 file to your TomTom MyDrive (and synced TomTom devices):
In a web browser, log in to your TomTom MyDrive.
Select My Places â†’ POI Files.
Select Import POI file.
Navigate to and upload your POI file.
The next time your TomTom device(s) syncs with your MyDrive, the POIs your OV2 file contains will appear in the device's My Places menu.
If you don't want to use TomTom MyDrive to add your OV2 file to your TomTom device, you can instead:
Use TomTom HOME (Windows, Mac) to import the OV2 file to the appropriate map directory on your device

Manually add the OV2 file to the appropriate map directory on your device (by connecting the device to your computer, selecting the drive that corresponds to your device, navigating to the appropriate map directory, and placing the OV2 file there)
You can use POI Editor, a free online application, to create or edit OV2 files:
To create a new OV2 file, select Add Point and begin adding POIs
To edit an existing OV2 file, select Load POI File, load your POI file, and add or remove POIs as needed
After you've finished creating or editing your POI list, select Save POI File to download the resulting OV2 file.
You can use POI Editor to convert OV2 files to the following formats:
.CSV - Comma-Separated Values
.ASC - ASCII Text
.KML - Keyhole Markup Language
.GPX - GPS Exchange
.ITN - TomTom Navigator Itineary
.LMX - Landmark Exchange
.UPOI - iGO Points of Interest
To do so, load your OV2 file in POI Editor, select Save POI File, and then download your POI list in your desired format.
